content: Development will move to the cloud because agents need to scale off of local machines.
The primary challenge for teams of agents is establishing a communication pattern and tracking their memory.
Instead of building agent-specific versions of human collaboration tools (like Slack or Notion), focus on minimal underlying infrastructure for agents to operate.

Essential primitives for multi-agent collaboration include: cloud operations for scalable communication, an easy and reliable inter-agent communication mechanism (e.g., message bus), persistent datastore for tracking work and output, a powerful coding agent, and a human-agent interface for steering and review.
Coding agents will be the foundation of all knowledge work because coding is the 'uber' skill that allows agents to do anything.
